required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Early Conversion of Dasatinib in CML-CP Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study on Early Conversion of Dasatinib in CML-CP Patients Who Have Not Early Molecular Response on Imatinib

lead_sponsor.agency: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

clinical_study.source: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) is a malignant disease of acquired hematopoietic stem cells. The BCR-ABL fusion gene is the pathogenic basis of CML. Tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs) are targeted drugs for this fusion protein. With the wide clinical application of TKIs, the efficacy of CML patients has been greatly improved. However, there are still a significant number of patients who have poor response to the first generation of TKI drugs, imatinib, most of them have early molecular response failures (BCR-ABL（IS）>10% at 3 or 6 months) ，which means lower rates of molecular response, increased risk of progression, and higher overall survival. For them, the early conversion of dasatinib might be a better choice.

primary_outcome.description: MMR(BCR/ABL(IS)<0.1%) at 12 months after switching to dasatinib for patients who did not achieve optimal treatment with imatinib for 3 to 6 months.

intervention.description: The CML-CP patients with early(3m to 6m) molecular response failure on imatinib,Conversion dasatinib group or Imatinib group

study_pop.textblock: CML-CP patients treated with imatinib failed to achieve the best therapeutic effect（BCR/ABLIS>10.00% in 3m or BCR/ABLIS>1.00% in 6m）convert to dasatinib.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University
